channel.title: satRDays on Moritz Mueller-Navarra
channel.description: Recent content in satRDays on Moritz Mueller-Navarra

item.title: satRdays Berlin 2019
item.description:
This is a short overview/recap from the satRDays [asd]https://berlin2019.satrdays.org in Berlin June 15th 2019, which I attended. I will shortly summarize the talks I attended and share links and further information on the topics. All code belong to the respective presenters as this only a wrap-up of the meeting. You find almost all the slides here:

slides: https://github.com/satRdays/berlin2019-slides

Talks

Some remedies for severe class imbalance

For me the day starts of with this very interesting talk by Juan Orduz. The main objective of his presentation is to illustrate techniques for handling class-imbalanced classification problems.

You find everything, code & slides, here:

https://juanitorduz.github.io/class_imbalance/ https://github.com/satRdays/berlin2019-slides/tree/master/1_Orduz

An overview on explainable AI in R

Gero Szepannek discusses the tradeoff between acuraccy and interpretibility between machine learning algrotihmns. He presents packages which are trying to shed light into the black box of many complex models, such as gbm’s and neural nets. Discussed packages:

  • iml
  • ingredients
  • DALEX
  • mlr
  • …

slides:

https://github.com/satRdays/berlin2019-slides/blob/master/2_Gero_Szepannek.pdf

Not all users are the same

Grace Meyer talks about analysing data from Android users using Hierarchical Clustering.

Estimating Berlin House Prices

https://github.com/satRdays/berlin2019-slides/tree/master/6_Corrie

Enhancing creativity in programming with R (keynote)

Isabella Gollini presents the usage of R from different perspectives

https://github.com/satRdays/berlin2019-slides/blob/master/8_Isabella_Gollini_2019.pdf

CRAN, R, and the people moving it forward (keynote)

It is always a pleasure to listen to a talk by one of the R Core Team members.

https://github.com/satRdays/berlin2019-slides/blob/master/9_Uwe_Ligges.pdf
